summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in semver (CVE-2022-25883) affecting the test coverage library. A Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) vulnerability was identified in semver-7.5.0 with a CVSS score of 7.5.
userImpact: Users' applications are potentially vulnerable to ReDoS attacks through untrusted semver range input in test dependencies.
rootCause: semver versions before 7.5.2 contain a ReDoS vulnerability in the Range function when processing untrusted user data.
proposedFix: Upgrade semver to version 7.5.2 or later.
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed by Mend as the vulnerable library was either marked as ignored or no longer part of inventory.
keyQuote: Versions of the package semver before 7.5.2 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the function new Range
